Industrial production in the first quarter of 2014 was 0.1 per cent higher than the corresponding quarter of 2013, data for April to June shows. It was 3.2 per cent lower than the corresponding quarter of 2012, the data show.

The index indicates the industry-specific share of manufacturing in the industrial production of a country. The index is calculated as the product of a country's manufacturing and services production shares and has a weighting of 100. The more the share of a given industry, the higher the index.
